page.title: 08Science and Technology
page.content: The Timber Research and Development ssociation,founded in 1934,moved to its Hughenden Valley site in 1967.It gives advice to the timber trade, dealing with 36000 enquiries in 1984.A design for the Thames Barrier hoods for use under the metal cladding and an investigation into the causes of the Bradford Football Club stand fire are recent national projects worked on here.Regular work includes testing roof trusses to destruction,advice on fungal decay and the matching of timbers.The reconstruction of Captain Scott's Antarctic Base Camp by the Australians was aided by TRADA identifying the original wood taken from England by the explorers.A school trains workers for the Timber Trade's firms. Uplands at Cryer's Hill provides residential facilities for training and holding conferences.
